AFSC GAP for Python

Community contributed Python-based tools for working with public bottom trawl surveys data from the NOAA Alaska Fisheries Science Center Groundfish Assessment Program (NOAA AFSC GAP). In addition to visual analytics tools that do not require code, it provides Pythonic access to the official API service with automated pagination, convienent contextual documentation, memory efficient zero catch (absence data) inference, and easy query generation / emulation for data filtering.

Open Source
Visit GitHub >>
Engage with the community on our GitHub: read the code, ask questions, report bugs, recommend features, and contribute patches.

Built as open source and with love for the community, released under the BSD License. Supporting researchers, scientists, engineers, and the public. Note that this is not an official project of NOAA but was initiated by UC Berkeley DSE.

Click to expand for notices, licenses, privacy

We encourage free and open access to information. To that end, this website does not use cookies and does not sell or, unless compelled by law, otherwise disclose personal data. However, like most websites, standard web server traffic logs may be generated by using it or by accessing its files (including metadata flat file datasets). These logs are necessary to prevent abuse, maintain security, and ensure performance. Logs may record IP address, resource requested, user agent / browser information, and timestamp. These raw logs are held for no more than five days after which they are erased or anonymized. Pyafscgap.org does not collect other information except through these logs. For more info or removal requests, please contact us or see privacy policy. That policy does not apply to webpages / files other than those at pyafscgap.org.
